Experience Program Administrator Stanford University May 2008  – Present (7 years 4 months) Stanford, CA •	Oversees and facilitate10-hospital regional cooperative agreements in accordance with California Children’s Services (CCS) provisions and ensure hospitals are in compliance. 
•	Advise and collaborate with contract hospital support team of programmatic needs to ensure standards under contracts are met. 
•	Negotiates renewal of contracts with hospitals to maintain CCS compliance with hospital administration, medical directors and nursing directors. 
•	Work collaboratively with Program Director to create and clarify program policies and procedures for establishment of program manual. 
•	Facilitates and coordinates faculty and staff for Perinatal Morbidity and Mortality Review conferences, committee meetings, annual and regional conferences. 
•	Develop program brochures and poster for marketing values. In addition to creating online registration tool for courses.  
•	Plans, negotiates, budgets and coordinates venue contracts for off site committee meetings, educational classes, workshops, and annual conferences with program Director. 
•	Process travel reimbursements, membership renewals, initiate requisitions, honorariums, checks deposits and other finance related items in Stanford’s Oracle Financial system.  
•	Purchasing cardholder and verifier for the Perinatal Program office.  
•	Travel card verifier for Program Director. 
•	Process and reconcile quarterly invoices for program services. 
•	Performs quarterly report on program accounts via ReportMart 3 for expenses and revenue of program. Program Assistant Stanford University June 2007  –  May 2008  (1 year) Stanford, CA •	Provided senior level support to Program Director, Quality Improvement Coordinators and faculty members as well as to the members of the Perinatal Programs in the division of Neonatology at Stanford School of Medicine. 
•	Organized calendars, coordinated meetings and conference calls; collated and prepared agendas, minutes and actions when required. 
•	Coordinated in-person committee meetings throughout California, as well as, act as on-site facilitator at each meeting.  
•	Prepared meeting folders, handouts, flyers, etc. for in-person committee meetings and education sessions.  
•	Prepared and coordinated monthly meetings via conference calls and WebEx for program committees.  
•	Handled professional correspondences between members and affiliates, including typing of letters, journal articles, and book chapters as well as creating PowerPoint presentations. 
•	Acted as liaison between program office and member contacts. 
•	Developed and maintained rosters, mail/contract databases, files and other important program contacts.  
•	Maintained and updated website as well as composed website materials, tools and interactions.  
•	Assisted the Director with program communications (i.e.: development of reports, spreadsheet preparation, composing/editing correspondence) 
•	Assisted in synthesizing high-level confidential maternal mortality cases.  
•	Performed and maintained general office environment and duties; in addition to purchasing office necessities.
